page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW.
page.content: The block is one of contrasts, residential housing in the west and farming in the east with the divide running almost down the middle of the block. The west mainly consists of the town of Whitefield now part of Bury M.B.C. and the districts of Unsworth and Sunny Bank. In the east the land is agricultural with the exception of the village of Simister. Communications with the rest of the country and surrounding area are excellent having two motorways the M66 and the M62 and a successful rail link with Manchester.The block contains two railway stations and a motorway junction linking the two motorways and providing access. In Whitefield the bus station is by theside of the railway station providing an important bus rail link.
